title: Accessing site-files
text: access site file - collated set data specific country - need follow steps: Sign github account, single user accounts free. Send email malariaverse@imperial.ac.uk ask site file access. Please include following details: name institution github username short description project use site files added malariaverse github team. receive confirmation (look notification github), can use site package inbuilt functionality download site files. can call fetch_site(), specifying ISO3c country code country interest. example, Nigeria: fetch_site(iso3c = "NGA"). first time , see interactive authentication instructions asking access github link providing authentication code. Open link copy code authorise access. process cache credentials don‚Äôt authorise every time.

title: Accessing site-files
text: Site files periodically updated. call fetch_site(), default accessing recent version site file. version can identified XXX able access older versions site files specifying additional arguments (e.g XXXX) calling fetch_site(). Older versions may longer supported malariaverse packages. News new updates posted .

title: Accessing site-files
text: encounter issues process, please post issue, much detail possible site package issue page.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$itn_use Due differences availability data sources approach countries within sub-Saharan Africa differs countries outside sub-Saharan Africa:

title: Interventions
text: population risk weighted mean ITN use estimates site taken malaria atlas project raster entitled: ‚ÄúInsecticide treated bednet (ITN) use version 2020‚Äù. , elements netz R package based work Bertozzi-Villa et al1

title: Interventions
text: ITN use much heterogeneous outside SSA data less systematically collected. result, strong assumptions associated historical scale magnitude ITN distributions. make assumption reported ITN distributions (detailed world malaria report2) targeted areas highest baseline prevalence prioritised first. Net use implemented maximum usage 55% area, sequentially working targeting reported total number bed nets allocated.

title: Interventions
text: Available data ITN use (via MAP3 world malaria report @ WMR) extend present year. Missing ITN use estimates present filled assuming constant, continuing level coverage. respect multi-year cyclical nature ITN distribution cycles missing estimates filled assuming coverage constant respect 3 years prior. example years 2019, 2020 2021 missing 2019 == 2016, 2020 == 2017 2021 == 2018.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$net_type assumed nets distributed prior 2025 standard pyrethroid (pyrethroid_only) bed nets. Current available net types : pyrethroid_only, pyrethroid_pbo pyrethroid_pyrrole.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$itn_input_dist Modelling Bed Net Use Malaria Model Observed data year, obtain estimate population-level usage bed nets available data. time series represents proportion population reported using bed nets annually. Model requirement incorporate observations model, calculate yearly coverage inputs align observed usage. inputs represent distribution nets ultimately result reported usage levels. Accounting net retention Bed nets distributed given year remain use multiple years, effective coverage diminishing time. Consequently, observed usage given year reflects nets distributed year also cumulative contribution nets distributed previous years. Back-calculation coverage inputs model uses observed usage time series reverse-engineer yearly net distributions required produce observed patterns. calculation incorporates assumptions net retention: Hhw long nets expected last distributed Capturing population-level dynamics combining distribution events multiple years overlapping effects, model accounts cumulative build-nets population. ensures simulated coverage reflects current residual effects past distributions.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$pyrethroid_resistance site include estimated level pyrethroid insecticide resistance. estimated Tom Churcher colleagues using spatio-temporally distributed bioassay mortality data. work yet published. Therefore attribution/citation information methods used please contact Pete Winskill Tom Churcher.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$dn0 site_file$interventions$rn0 site_file$interventions$gamman site_file$interventions$rnm Given ITN type level pyrethroid insecticide resistance, can link corresponding estimates key ITN efficacy parameters. estimated Ellie Sherrard-Smith et al4. Please note gamman provided units years , need converted days use malariasimulaiton.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$irs_cov ITNs, due differences availability data sources approach countries within sub-Saharan Africa differs countries outside sub-Saharan Africa:

title: Interventions
text: population risk weighted mean IRS coverage estimates site taken malaria atlas project raster entitled: ‚ÄúIndoor Residual Spraying (IRS) coverage version 2020‚Äù3. Coverage estimates rescaled country-level estimate number persons protected IRS matches number reported world malaria report2.

title: Interventions
text: IRS coverage much heterogeneous outside SSA data less systematically collected. result, strong assumptions associated historical scale magnitude IRS campaigns. make assumption reported persons protected IRS (detailed world malaria report2) targeted areas highest baseline prevalence prioritised first. IRS coverage implemented maximum usage of80% area, sequentially working targeting reported total number persons protected allocated.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$irs_insecticide assumed DDT-type insecticide used prior 2017, switch actellic-like insecticide. Current available IRS insecticide options : ddt, actellic, bendiocarb, sumishield.

what: Number of rounds of IRS per year
title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$irs_spray_rounds assume single IRS spray round per year.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$ls_theta site_file$interventions$ls_gamma site_file$interventions$ks_theta site_file$interventions$ks_gamma site_file$interventions$ms_theta site_file$interventions$ms_gamma Given IRS insecticide type can link corresponding estimates key IRS efficacy parameters. estimated Ellie Sherrard-Smith et al5.

title: Interventions
text: often helpful convert number persons protected IRS estimate number households covered. aid conversion included country-levels estimates average household size obtained UN6. site_file$interventions$hh_size

title: Interventions
text: Available data IRS coverage (via MAP3 world malaria report2) extend present year. Missing IRS coverage estimates present filled assuming constant, continuing level coverage.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$tx_cov population risk weighted mean treatment coverage effective antimalarial site taken malaria atlas project raster entitled: ‚ÄúEffective treatment Antimalarial drug version 2020‚Äù3.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$prop_act estimate proportion treatments ACT DHS StatCompiler data7, using indicator: ‚ÄúChildren took ACT‚Äù (ID: ML_AMLD_C_ACT). SSA estimates year expanded linear interpolation data points assumption constant coverage recent data point. assume ACT coverage zero 2006, recommendation first issued. outside SSA DHS indicator confounded treatment Plasmodium vivax, therefore assume mean values year data within SSA.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$prop_public include estimate proportion treatments public sector prop_public. useful costing. use DHS StatCompiler7 indicator ‚ÄúChildren fever advice treatment sought, source public sector facility‚Äù (ID: ML_FEVA_C_PUB). assume constant proportion time country, estimated mean country survey estimates since 2010. countries without survey data, assume median across estimates.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$smc_cov Historical SMC implementation coverage estimates fragmented. identify historical SMC implementation areas maps presented Access SMC8 recently SMC alliance9. assume linear increase coverage post implementation initiation maximum 80% capture increasing number smaller sub-national units targeted time.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$smc_drug assume SP-AQ used SMC. currently available drug option.

what: Number of SMC rounds delivered annualy
title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$smc_n_rounds assumed historical SMC delivered 4 rounds smc_n_rounds.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$smc_min_age site_file$interventions$smc_max_age assume SMC delivered children aged 3 months 5 years.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$rtss_cov include historical RTS,S coverage occurred part MVIP implementation trial, sub-nationally Malawi, Ghana Kenya. spatial distribution informed MVIP briefing presentation10

title: Interventions
text: intervention known past intermittent preventative treatment infants (IPTi).

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$pmc_cov Due limited (non-trial setting) implementation PMC historically, assume 0 coverage.

title: Interventions
text: site_file$interventions$pmc_drug assume PMC implemented SP. currently available drug option.

title: Metadata
text: site_file$country ISO3c code identifying country. R package countrycode1 useful converting ISO3c country names.

title: Metadata
text: site_file$version year version site file.

title: Metadata
text: site_file$admin_level administrative level (e.g.¬†state, region, province) sites within site file.

title: Metadata
text: site_file$sites sites within site file. named sites disaggregated specified administrative level. disaggregation may include, example, urban rural split. use GADM2 version 4.04 administrative boundary simple feature spatial files first second administrative unit level.

title: Seasonality
text: site_file$seasonality Daily rainfall global rasters period 2019-2021 obtained CHIRPS1 using umbrella R package. site estimate fourier series parameters representing general seasonal profiles. Please see umbrella website information.

title: Historical Epidemiological Data
text: site_file$cases_deaths available includes time series cases deaths country reported previous editions world malaria report. useful data include world malaria report1 population risk uncertainty intervals estimates.

title: Historical Epidemiological Data
text: site_file$prevalence available includes population risk weighted average parasite prevalence time series Malaria Atlas Project2 Plasmodium falciparuim parasite prevalence (PfPr) reported children aged 2-10 years, summarized malaria atlas project raster entitled: ‚ÄúPlasmodium falciparum PR2 - 10 version 2020‚Äù. Plasmodium vivax parasite prevalence (PvPr) reported individuals aged 1-99 years, summarized malaria atlas project raster entitled: ‚ÄúPlasmodium vivax PR1-99 version 2020‚Äù. Prevalence estimates used calibrating baseline EIR using cali package.

title: Population and Demography
text: site_file$population Site-level population estimates extracted pixel level WorldPop1. use ‚ÄúUnconstrained individual countries 2000-2020 UN adjusted ( 1km resolution )‚Äù rasters.

title: Population and Demography
text: Urban rural splits within administrative unit defined using threshold density 1500 people per square km.

title: Population and Demography
text: site_file$population$par_pf site_file$population$par_pv site_file$population$par Population risk Plasmodium falciparum, Plasmodium vivax estimated masking total population raster areas active transmission (prevalence >0%) year 20002.

title: Population and Demography
text: provide annual population projections 2050 using UN data total population growthunwpp? combined UN projections levels urbanisation3. use projections produces estimates rate urban rural growth (relative baseline year) applied spatial-unit population estimates. Final estimates rescaled ensure population total match UN totals.

title: Population and Demography
text: Population demographics (age structure) defined time site. Demography obtained using peeps R package, based data UN WPPunwpp?. Mortality rates specified neonates (0-30 days), young infants (31 days - 1 year), older infants (1 year - 5 years) five year age bands.

title: Mosquito Vectors
text: countries sub-Saharan Africa statistical model relative abundance major vectors produced Sinka et al1 countries extract relative abundance arabiensis, funestus gambiae using malaria atlas project ‚ÄúAnopheles arabiensis Patton, 1905‚Äù, ‚ÄúAnopheles funestus‚Äù ‚ÄúAnopheles gambiae Giles, 1902‚Äù rasters. Proportions normalised sum one (species may present data).

title: Mosquito Vectors
text: countries outside sub-Saharan Africa estimates relative abundance vectors species. however probability occurrence maps large number species Sinka et al2. locations select maximum three species ranked average probability occurrence across site. species given equally weighted relative abundance.

title: Mosquito Vectors
text: site_file$vectors$blood_meal_rates site_file$vectors$foraging_time site_file$vectors$Q0 site_file$vectors$phi_bednets site_file$vectors$phi_indoors site_file$vectors$mum bionomics parameters vectors sub-Saharan Africa parameterised using fitted parameters malarisimulation. vectors parameterised (unpublished) literature review Arran Hamlet. unknown species assigned median vector bionomics parameters across species site. Please contact Pete Winskill directly using estimates. blood_meal_rates, foraging_time mum parameters assumed fixed previously fitted values.

title: Site specific malariasimulation modelling
text: site-file file storing sub nationally disaggregated information country. Components site-file include: metadata, high level information country site-file version. Historical Epidemiological Data estimates cases, deaths parasite prevalence. Population Demography information. Estimates Historical Intervention Use country. Rainfalll Seasonality data. Information Mosquito Vectors

title: Site specific malariasimulation modelling
text: Please see detailed guide information gain access download site files.

what: Translating site-file information to malariasimulation parameters
title: Site specific malariasimulation modelling
text: access site file, need run model Isolate single site, single sub-national unit within country Create parameter list Pass malariasimulation run simulation
code: # Pull information for a single sub-national unit from the site-file site <- subset_site(   site = example_site,   site_filter = data.frame(   country = "Burkina Faso",   iso3c = "BFA",   name_1 = "Sahel",   urban_rural = "rural")   )  # Convert site information to malariasimulation parameters site_par <- site_parameters(   interventions = site$interventions,   demography = site$demography,   vectors = site$vectors$vector_species,   seasonality = site$seasonality$seasonality_parameters,   eir = site$eir$eir,   overrides = list(     human_population = 1000   ) )  # Run the model! site_sim <- malariasimulation::run_simulation(   timesteps = site_par$timesteps,   parameters = site_par )

title: Get files from the malariaverse sitefile server. ‚Äî fetch_files
text: name name orderly report. parameters named list parameters use searching orderly packet. query expression `expr` specified, parameters substituted query using : prefix. expression specified, latest packet matching parameters exactly selected. dest directory files copied. files optionally-named character vector files copy packet destination directory. vector named, names used destination file path. expr query expression filter packets. may arbitrary orderly query, including literal packet ID. absent NULL, specified list parameters used matched exactly.
